alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Lower Iberia; Lower St. Martin; Lower St. Mary; Lower Vermilion; St. Landry; Upper Iberia; Upper St. Martin; Upper St. Mary; Upper Vermilion (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 1:28PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Iberia, Lafayette, northwestern St. Mary, eastern Vermilion, St. Martin and southeastern St. Landry Parishes through 245 PM CDT... At 128 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Atchafalaya National Wildlife Refuge to near Lake Fausse Pointe to 6 miles southwest of Avery Island. Movement was west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, New Iberia, Abbeville, Catahoula, Scott, Breaux Bridge, Franklin, Carencro, St. Martinville, Jeanerette, Kaplan, Leonville, Arnaudville, Freshwater City, Forked Island, Intracoastal City, Avery Island, Burns Point, Cypremort Point and Broussard. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 93 and 128. Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
